refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

para.para: Functions operate on arrays of data. The arrays can be either source arrays (input only), destination arrays (output only), or in-place arrays (both input and output).

The interpretation of a parameter can usually be determined from its name. Parameters for arrays are of the form d1_1xn, where the first character represents the direction (source, destination, or in-place), the second represents the index for that particular direction, and the characters after the underscore indicate the size of the array. In this case, "1xn" represents an array that is 1 by N. Note that the index and the size can both be omitted, giving a default of 1 for the index and 1xn for the size.
Parameters that represent strides are of the form "d1s". The interpretation is similar to above, except that the s indicates a stride parameter.

The exceptions to the above rule are "dest", "src", "dstr", "sstr", etc. These are aliases for "d1", "s1", "d1s", and "s1s", respectively. This form is deprecated and will be removed in the 0.4 series.
Two special parameters are "n" and "m", which determine the size of the arrays in other parameters.

Data arrays are laid out such that rows are separated by the number of bytes given by the corresponding stride. Elements in each row are contiguous. If there is no stride parameter corresponding to an array, the rows of the array are contiguous.

refsect2.title: OilFunctionClass
refsect2.para: An opaque structure representing a function class.

refsect2.title: OIL_DECLARE_CLASS()
refsect2.para: Declares the Liboil function class klass.

listitem.simpara: the name of a function class (without the oil_ prefix)

refsect2.title: OIL_DEFINE_CLASS_FULL()
refsect2.para: Defines a OilFunctionClass structure for klass. Classes defined this way will be automatically at Liboil initialization time.

listitem.simpara: name of class to declare (without oil_ prefix)

refsect2.title: OIL_DEFINE_CLASS()
refsect2.para: Defines a OilFunctionClass structure for klass. Classes defined this way will be automatically at Liboil initialization time.

listitem.simpara: name of class to declare (without oil_ prefix)

refsect2.title: oil_class_get_by_index ()
refsect2.para: Returns a pointer to the function class with index i.

refsect2.title: oil_class_get ()
refsect2.para: Returns a pointer to the function class that has the given class name. If no such class is found, NULL is returned.

listitem.simpara: the name of the function class
a pointer to a function class

refsect2.title: oil_class_optimize ()
refsect2.para: Tests and profiles each implementation for the given function class. Testing compares the output of running each implementation on random input against the reference implementation for the same input.

refsect2.title: oil_class_get_n_classes ()
refsect2.para: Returns the number of function classes.

refsect2.title: oil_class_choose_by_name ()
refsect2.para: Sets the chosen implementation for the given function class to the implementation with the given name. If no implementation having the given name is found, the chosen implementation is not changed.

refsect2.title: oil_class_register_impl_by_name ()
refsect2.para: Adds impl to the list of implementations associated with the function class given by klass_name.

refsect2.title: oil_class_register_impl ()
refsect2.para: Adds impl to the list of implementations associated with the function class given by klass.

refsect2.title: oil_class_register_impl_full ()
refsect2.programlisting: void oil_class_register_impl_full (OilFunctionClass *klass, void (funcvoid) (), const char *name, unsigned int flags);
refsect2.para: Adds func to the list of implementations associated with the function class given by klass.
